validation_commands.output: test result: ok. 45 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out

learnings.what_worked: Reed-Solomon erasure coding integration using reed-solomon-erasure crate, CID-based storage layout, clean modular architecture with separate service modules (erasure, storage, p2p, quic, audit_monitor, chain_client), comprehensive unit tests covering edge cases (empty data, insufficient shards, disk full scenarios)
learnings.what_was_hard: libp2p integration complexity with GossipSub and Kademlia DHT, QUIC server implementation with proper connection handling, audit monitor with chain subscription and proof generation, DHT manifest publishing requires P2P service refactor for proper separation of concerns

token_usage.reason: Higher complexity due to P2P networking, erasure coding edge cases, comprehensive test coverage including error scenarios

recommendations: Complete DHT manifest publishing in future iteration (requires P2P service refactor to accept manifest publishing requests via channel)
Add integration tests with actual libp2p network (not just mocked components)
Implement resource limit enforcement (10TB storage cap, 500 Mbps bandwidth throttling)
Add disk usage monitoring and alerting (>80% threshold)
Configure monitoring alerts for audit failures and storage cleanup errors

technical_debt.notes: 9 TODOs in code for future enhancements (DHT publishing, extrinsic submission with chain metadata, slot parsing from metadata), none blocking for MVP
